notes.text:
This update for tcpdump fixes the following issues:

Security issues fixed:

- CVE-2019-1010220: Fixed a buffer over-read in print_prefix() which may expose data (bsc#1142439).
- CVE-2017-16808: Fixed a heap-based buffer over-read related to aoe_print() and lookup_emem() (bsc#1068716).
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: tcpdump before 4.9.3 has a heap-based buffer over-read related to aoe_print in print-aoe.c and lookup_emem in addrtoname.c.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: tcpdump.org tcpdump 4.9.2 is affected by: CWE-126: Buffer Over-read. The impact is: May expose Saved Frame Pointer, Return Address etc. on stack. The component is: line 234: "ND_PRINT((ndo, "%s", buf));", in function named "print_prefix", in "print-hncp.c". The attack vector is: The victim must open a specially crafted pcap file.
notes.title: Vulnerability description
